description: Minor material amendment application (under Section 73 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended)) to vary conditions 2 (Approved Plans), 3(Tenure Mix), and 7 (Electric Vehicles Charging Points) and the removal of conditions 6 (Travel Plan) and 21 (Travel Plan) of planning permission 161602FUL dated 15/07/2016 for the 'Construction of five, two-storey terraced houses and five, two-storey apartment buildings containing 10 flats (comprising 15 residential units of 11 x two-bedroom, 2 x three-bedroom and 2 x four-bedroom units in a mix of Affordable Rent, Shared Ownership and Outright Sale tenures), 15 car parking spaces, site landscaping, refuse and recycling storage facilities, bicycle storage facilities and partial stopping-up of West End Gardens and formation of a new street and turning head, following the demolition of four terraced dwellings (Nos. 7a, 7b, 8a and 8b West End Gardens).' Minor material amendment application to increase affordable rent tenure to provide 2x two bedroom houses, 1x three bedroom house, 2x four bedroom houses, 5x two bedroom flats and 1x three bedroom flat in affordable (resulting in no increase in the number of units within the approved scheme) including consequential internal layout alterations; and, provision of two active charging points for electric vehicles and four passive charging points for electric vehicles
decision_conditions: The development permitted has already commenced in accordance with Section 56 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:

P-001; P-002; P-020; P-030; P-032; P-033; P-034; P-035; P-040; P-041; P-050; P-BA-300; P-BB-300; P-BA-320; P-BA-321; P-BA-322; P-BA-323; P-BA-324; P-BB-320; P-BB-321; P-BA-350; P-BB-350; P-BA-360; P-040; P-041; P-050; P-T-320; P-T-321; P-T-322; P-T-350; P-TA-300; P-TB-300; P-TC-300; Design and Access Statement dated April 2016 prepared by Stitch; Planning Stage Energy Statement (Rev 0) prepared by White Associates; West End Gardens Sustainability Statement prepared by Silver; Transport Statement ref: 30855/D1a dated April 2016 prepared by Transport Planning Practice; Contamination Testing Factual Report ref: 730905/MR dated 23/11/2015 prepared by Structural Soils Ltd; Arboricultural Impact Assessment and Arboricultural Method Statement ref: ASDC102/002/001/002 dated April 2016 prepared by Thompson Ecology; Preliminary Ecological Appraisal & Bat Inspection ref: ASDC102/001&003/001/002 dated April 2016 prepared by Thompson Ecology; Noise Assessment V01 dated 21/03/2016 prepared by Hawkins Environmental; Drainage arrangements and highways works shown on drawings: A3695-1500 P0; A3695-1500 P2; A3695-SK1501 P1; A3695-SK1502 P1; A3695-1801 P3; and, 1695(9-)02 Rev F.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| The development hereby approved shall be provided in accordance with the approved Tenure Mix Plan ref: 1695(9-)02 Rev F and shall include 2 x two-bedroom houses, 1 x three-bedroom house and 2 x four-bedroom houses (total of five houses) in Affordable Rent tenure, 5 x two-bedroom flats and 1 x three-bedroom flat (total of six flats) in Affordable Rent tenure, and 2 x two-bedroom-flats in Shared Ownership tenure, and the London Borough of Ealing shall be the Registered Provider in respect of the approved affordable housing.

Reason: To ensure that the affordable housing is provided in accordance with the approved plans and documents, in accordance with policies 3.11, 3.12, 3.13 and 3.14 of the London Plan (2016); policy 1.2(a) of Ealing's adopted Development Strategy 2026 (2012); and policy 3A of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD (2013).

| The approved surface water drainage scheme shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the final phase of the development and the proposed run-off rates, volumes and SuDs features shall be managed and maintained in perputuity in accordance with the strategy approved on 23rd May 2017 under permission reference 171023CND.

Reason: To ensure that the site is adequately drained to reduce the risk of flooding to the proposed development and locality, and to enhance water quality and biodiversity, in accordance with the objectives of Section 11 of the NPPF; policies 5.3, 5.12, 5.13 and 5.14 of the London Plan (2016); policy 1.2(m) of Ealing's adopted Development Strategy 2026 (2012), and policy LV5.12 of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD (2013). | Development shall not commence until a revised Arboricultural Method Statement for the protection of the trees identified as T2, T6 (neighbouring site), G1 (neighbouring site) and G3 (neighbouring site) as shown within the submitted Arboricultural Impact Assessment and Arboricultural Method Statement ref: ASDC102/002/001/002 dated April 2016 prepared by Thompson Ecology, and a suitable monitoring programme for the tree protection measures have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. If the retention of the tree identified as T2 is not viable due to unavoidable development constraints, then justification and details of the removal of this tree shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, with the relevant mitigation measures agreed with the Council's Tree Service.
Details of the revised Arboricultural Method statement shall include the following:

a.	Full survey of all trees on site and those within influencing distance on adjacent sites in accordance with BS5837*, with tree works proposals.  All trees must be plotted on a site plan**, clearly and accurately depicting trunk locations, root protection areas and canopy spreads.
b.	A plan** detailing all trees, shrubs, hedges planned for retention and removal.
c.	Soil assessments/survey
d.	Timing and phasing of works
e.	Site specific demolition and hard surface removal specifications
f.	Site specific construction specifications
g.	Access arrangements and car parking
h.	Level changes

i.	A Tree protection plan** in accordance with BS5837* detailing all methods of protection, including but not restricted to: locations of construction exclusion zones, root protection areas, fit for purpose fencing and ground protection, service routes, works access space, material/machinery/waste storage and permanent & temporary hard surfaces.
j.	Soil remediation plans.
k.	Confirmation of who shall be the lead Arboriculturalist and the Site Manager for the development, including their contact details;
l.	Procedures for dealing with variations or non-approved incursions into the construction exclusion zones as detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement.
m.	Agreements of when site monitoring will take place with the local Tree Officer either by site meetings or by some other pre-arranged agreement.
n.	Post development assessment of the retained and planted trees and any necessary remedial action.

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works associated with that Phase, including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained. The program of Arboricultural monitoring shall be taken in full compliance with the approved details.
*Using the most recent revision the of the Standard
** Plans must be of a minimum scale of 1:200 (unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority)

Reason: Details of the Arboricultural Method Statement and a programme of monitoring the tree works are required prior to the commencement of any site preparation works because such works would carry a high risk of damaging trees and other vegetation, particularly by site operatives that are not experienced to carry out works around trees. The protection of trees and other vegetation is required in accordance with policies 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016), and interim SPG 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. The tree protection measures shall be retained throughout the demolition of existing buildings and construction of the approved development, in accordance with the recommendations in BS5837 (2012).
| Deleted.

| Two of the approved car parking spaces shall be equipped with active charging points for electric vehicles, and an additional four car parking spaces shall be equipped with passive charging provision. The facilities for electric vehicle charging shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the final phase of the development.
Note: The timing of full compliance with this condition takes into consideration that the development is being constructed over two phases.
Reason: In the interest of the environment and improving air quality, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan (2016); and policy 1.2(k) of Ealing's Development Strategy 2026 (2012).

| Within three-months of the commencement of development, a revised energy strategy which includes full details of the sustainability measures that are to be incorporated into the dwellings shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority. The submitted revised energy strategy shall demonstrate that the development will achieve an overall minimum reduction in carbon dioxide emissions by 35% over and beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013. In demonstrating compliance with this percentage reduction the applicant should consider the use of measures in line with the Energy Hierarchy including the incorporation of on-site renewables.

This reduction should be calculated based on carbon dioxide emissions covered by the Building Regulations, whilst carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) should be also included and measures to reduce them should be demonstrated.

Within three-months of the first occupation of final phase of development, Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's], Display Energy Certificates (DEC's) and Accompany Advisory Reports and detailed SAP modelling output reports showing clearly the DER and TER for each unit from the "as built stage" following completion of each phase of the development to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures should be also submitted for written approval by the Local Planning Authority.
Note: The timing of full compliance with this condition takes into consideration that the development is being constructed over two phases.

Reason:  To ensure that the development is energy efficient and to reduce the use of fossil fuels and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases; and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development Strategy 2026 DPD (2012), policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG (2014).

| Each residential unit shall incorporate an Ultra low-NOx gas boiler for space heating and hot water requirements with dry NOx Emissions below 40 mg/kWh prior to the first occupation of the relevant unit.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development, and to reduce the impact of the development on air quality, in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 of the London Plan 2015, policy LV5.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development Strategy 2026 DPD (2012), and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG (2014).

| Upon final completion of the development and prior to occupation, suitable devices for monitoring the renewable/low-carbon energy equipment shall be installed. The monitored data shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority at daily intervals for a period of three years from final completion. The installation of the monitoring devices should be in a compatible format and the submission of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in Automated Energy (& CO2) Monitoring Platform [AEMP] document.

Reason: To monitor the effectiveness of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an evidence base on the performance of such equipment in accordance with policies 5.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 5.7 of the London Plan (2016).

| Within three months of the commencement of the development, the details of the dynamic thermal modelling for each dwelling using the guidance provided in CIBSE TM49 & TM52 shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. The details shall demonstrate that the development performs against the overheating criteria and exceeds the requirements to avoid overheating. The details of any additional measures to be incorporated into the development to minimise the risk of overheating (without active cooling) shall also be submitted if the dynamic thermal modelling demonstrates that overheating would occur.
The development shall thereafter be provided in accordance with the approved details.
Reason: To ensure that the risk of overheating has been sufficiently addressed in accordance with policy 5.9 of the London Plan (2016).

| Prior to the first occupation of the final phase of development, the approved car parking spaces, hard and soft landscaping, footpaths and boundary treatments shown on the approved plans and in the approved Design and Access Statement shall be provided and ready for use.

All soft landscaping shall be carried out in the earliest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive). The quality of all approved landscape works shall be in accordance with British Standard 4428:1989 'Code of Practice for General Landscape Operations' or any subsequent revision.  All trees included within the approved scheme shall be healthy, well-formed specimens with single leading shoots and shall be of a minimum quality compatible with British Standard 3936:1992 (Part 1) 'Specifications For Trees & Shrubs' and British Standard 4043 (where applicable) or any subsequent revisions and BS: 8545:2014 Trees: from nursery to independence in the landscape.  Any trees that within a period of 5 years from the completion of all tree planting, that die, are removed, uprooted, are significantly damaged, become diseased or malformed shall be replaced during the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive) with others of the same size, species and quality as approved. The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved plans and work phasing plan.
The approved details shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the positive visual character and appearance of the area; to ensure that the necessary boundary treatments are incorporated into the development in the interests of meeting the Secured by Design principles; in order to ensure that the site landscaping is provided in accordance with an agreed timeframe; in order to provide a good level of privacy for future users / occupants, in accordance with policies LV2.18, LV7.3, LV7.4, 7B and 7D of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); 2.18, 7.4, 7.13, 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); policies 1.1(h) and (i), 2.10, 5.3, 5.4 and 6.3 of Ealing's Development Strategy 2026 (2012), and interim SPG 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'.

| Sound insulation and noise control measures for the approved residential dwellings shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets described at Section 4(B) 'Criteria for adequate protection for new buildings' of Ealing's interim SPG 10:
Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast)
Living rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 35dB LAeq
Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq
The sound insulation and noise control measures shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the development and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the amenity of the residential occupiers of the new development from traffic noise, in accordance with policies 3.2, 3.18 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG; and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration.

| The approved residential units shall be designed and constructed to achieve a water use target that complies with Paragraph 36(2) of Approved Document G2 (water efficiency) of the Building Regulations 2015.
Reason: To ensure the sustainable use of water, in accordance with the objectives of policy 5.15 of the London Plan (2016).

| The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details and samples of all facing materials details approved under permission reference 172042CND on 07th June 2017 and retained thereafter as approved.

Reason: To ensure that the materials are of a high-quality specification and make a positive contribution to the streetscape, in accordance with policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's Development Strategy 2026 (2012), and policies 7.1 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| The bicycle storage facilities shown on the approved drawings and comprising 2 storage spaces for each of the dwellinghouses (within the front or rear gardens), and 2 storage spaces each for the 10 flats (within a communal store) shall be ready for use prior to the first occupation of the relevant dwelling the facility serves and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided within the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1(k) and (g) of Ealing's Development Strategy 2026 (2012), and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG.
| The refuse and recycling enclosures shown on the approved plans shall be ready for use prior to the first occupation of the relevant dwelling that it serves and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To secure the necessary recycling and waste enclosures to support the development and to ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and in accordance with policy 5.17 of the London Plan (2016); policy 1.1(e) of Ealing's Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 7A, LV7.4 and 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); and interim SPG 4: Refuse and Recyling Facilities.

| The five terraced houses and four ground floor flats in Flat Block Type BA (shown on approved drawings P-TA-300, P-TB-300, P-TC-300, P-BA-300) shall be designed and constructed to meet Approved Document M (Volume 1: Dwellings), Part M4(2) (Accessible and adaptable dwellings) of Building Regulations 2015.

Whilst full compliance with the abovementioned standards could not be achieved for the five upper floor flats, the applicant shall use their best endeavours to ensure that these flats are designed and constructed to comply with Approved Document M (Volume 1: Dwellings), Part M4(2) (Accessible and adaptable dwellings) of Building Regulations 2015, with the exception of the relevant parts of Section 2A: 'Approach to the dwelling' of the regulations.

Reason:  To ensure that the development is adaptable, flexible, convenient and appropriate to the changing needs of the future occupiers in accordance with policies 3.5, 3.8 and 3.9 of the London Plan (2016); and policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2026 (2012). | The adaptable wheelchair user dwellings comprising 1 x two-bedroom flat at ground floor level of Flat Block Type BB (shown on approved drawing P-BB-300) shall be designed and constructed to meet Approved Document M (Volume 1: Dwellings), Part M4(3) (Wheelchair user dwellings) of Building Regulations 2015.

Reason: To ensure the provision of wheelchair housing in a timely fashion that would address the current unmet housing need; produce a sustainable mix of accommodation; and provide an appropriate choice and housing opportunity for wheelchair users and their families, in accordance with the objectives of policies: 3.5, 3.8 and 3.9 of the London Plan (2016); and policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's Development Strategy (2012).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) no development to any dwellinghouse hereby approved under Classes A-H (inclusive) of Part 1, Schedule 2 to the said Order shall be carried out or constructed without express planning permission.

Reason:  To enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain control over extensions and other alterations to dwellinghouses in the interests of the design and character of the properties, the visual amenities of the locality and amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties and in view of the limited area of the private gardens assocaited with the houses, in accordance with policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2015, policies 1.1(h) and 1.2(f) of the Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policies LV7.4, 7B and 7D of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).
| Deleted.
